results.title: Freedom
results.creator_credit: Bob Gatherum, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: During his trip back to Normandy on the 65th anniversary of D-day, Bob Gatherum reflects on the lasting legacy of war. Travelling through Normandy, he was surprised and amazed at the appreciation shown by the local people whose freedom he and his fellow soldiers had helped protect.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Gatherum, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: For all who served
results.creator_credit: Jack Holdsworth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jack Holdsworth is one of the few remaining ‘Rats of Tobruk’. Here he reflects fondly on his time during the war and how the extreme circumstances created a strong bond between soldiers and their commanding officers. This bond, as Jack puts it, is a ‘hard habit to break’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Holdsworth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Jack Holdsworth is one of the few remaining ‘Rats of Tobruk’. Here he reflects fondly on his time during the war and how the extreme circumstances created a strong bond between soldiers and their commanding officers. This bond, as Jack puts it, is a ‘hard habit to break’.

results.title: The Correspondence
results.creator_credit: Gordon White, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite being born on Friday the 13th, Gordon White was always considered to be lucky. With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gordon White, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Despite being born on Friday the 13th, Gordon White was always considered to be lucky. With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.
description_for_label: Despite being born on Friday the 13th, Gordon White was always considered to be lucky. With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.

results.title: Walk - Walk - Walk
results.brief_description: In 1966 Paul was playing in a band, ‘The Castaways’, the next minute he was conscripted to service in Vietnam. When Paul arrived in Vietnam he was told, “You’re in the infantry now, you will walk, and walk, and walk some more. You had to keep on moving, that was how you got through.”
results.description: In 1966 Paul was playing in a band, ‘The Castaways’, the next minute he was conscripted to service in Vietnam. When Paul arrived in Vietnam he was told, “You’re in the infantry now, you will walk, and walk, and walk some more. You had to keep on moving, that was how you got through.”
description_for_label: In 1966 Paul was playing in a band, ‘The Castaways’, the next minute he was conscripted to service in Vietnam. When Paul arrived in Vietnam he was told, “You’re in the infantry now, you will walk, and walk, and walk some more. You had to keep on moving, that was how you got through.”

results.title: Remembering 1945
results.brief_description: Jude remembers her childhood and realises so much of her young life involved war and trauma. Visiting her father in the repatriation hospital she saw first-hand the effects of WWII on those that returned. Most of the men in her family went to WWII and she recalls how the family never recovered from the loss of one cousin at the hands of the Japanese as a POW.
results.description: Jude remembers her childhood and realises so much of her young life involved war and trauma. Visiting her father in the repatriation hospital she saw first-hand the effects of WWII on those that returned. Most of the men in her family went to WWII and she recalls how the family never recovered from the loss of one cousin at the hands of the Japanese as a POW.

Visiting her father in the repatriation hospital she saw first-hand the effects of WWII on those that returned. Most of the men in her family went to WWII and she recalls how the family never recovered from the loss of one cousin at the hands of the Japanese as a POW.

results.title: A Rookie airman's story
results.brief_description: Cliff’s father was a fisherman, so he knew about boats. After joining the airforce in 1942 he would spend the majority of his service running missions on boats. Lucky he didn’t tell them he couldn’t swim.
results.description: Cliff’s father was a fisherman, so he knew about boats. After joining the airforce in 1942 he would spend the majority of his service running missions on boats. Lucky he didn’t tell them he couldn’t swim.

results.title: An Airman at sea
results.brief_description: As Keith flew from Townsville to Milne Bay in Papua New Guinea, he wondered if he would ever see the shores of Australia again. Suffering from dengue fever, Keith battled illness the whole time. He made it back when the war ended and would go on to serve in the RAFF for 20 years.
results.description: As Keith flew from Townsville to Milne Bay in Papua New Guinea, he wondered if he would ever see the shores of Australia again. Suffering from dengue fever, Keith battled illness the whole time. He made it back when the war ended and would go on to serve in the RAFF for 20 years.

Suffering from dengue fever, Keith battled illness the whole time. He made it back when the war ended and would go on to serve in the RAFF for 20 years.

results.title: Will you hold my hand?
results.brief_description: Pegg Utting was one of the first women to join the newly formed WAAAF in 1941. Her son would later join up to serve in Vietnam aged 17. Like so many others he struggled to fit in when he returned. After many years, he was finally invited to March with the RSL and it was Peg’s loving support that got him through this.
results.description: Pegg Utting was one of the first women to join the newly formed WAAAF in 1941. Her son would later join up to serve in Vietnam aged 17. Like so many others he struggled to fit in when he returned. After many years, he was finally invited to March with the RSL and it was Peg’s loving support that got him through this.

results.title: A Naive country kid
results.brief_description:
At 17 Greg joined the air force and his role would be to give the aircraft the best chance of surviving a crash. Two years after joining up, Greg was sent to Thailand and one particular aircraft rescue would change his outlook on life forever.
Called out to an aircraft crash to help the Americans contain a huge fire, the Aussies were unaware where the aircraft had come from. After the flames were put out, Greg would realise this was a Thai plane that he had flown on many times. The memory of this day would stay with him all his life.
results.description:
At 17 Greg joined the air force and his role would be to give the aircraft the best chance of surviving a crash. Two years after joining up, Greg was sent to Thailand and one particular aircraft rescue would change his outlook on life forever.
Called out to an aircraft crash to help the Americans contain a huge fire, the Aussies were unaware where the aircraft had come from. After the flames were put out, Greg would realise this was a Thai plane that he had flown on many times. The memory of this day would stay with him all his life.

At 17 Greg joined the air force and his role would be to give the aircraft the best chance of surviving a crash. Two years after joining up, Greg was sent to Thailand and one particular aircraft rescue would change his outlook on life forever.
Called out to an aircraft crash to help the Americans contain a huge fire, the Aussies were unaware where the aircraft had come from. After the flames were put out, Greg would realise this was a Thai plane that he had flown on many times. The memory of this day would stay with him all his life.
